title: HOW TO BUILD THE ULTIMATE NO DIG GARDEN! (USING COVER CROPS AS A SHEET MULCH)

tasks.task: Prepare garden plot using silage tarp and cover crop.
subtasks: Acquire a UV-treated silage tarp (105 feet long, 24 feet wide).
Cut the tarp to create desired garden bed size (e.g., 50 feet long).
Ensure the bed is wet before tarping by running sprinklers for an hour.
Lay tarps on garden plot, ensuring it is completely covered and sealed around edges.
Apply additional water if needed to create a steamy environment beneath the tarp.
Let tarp cover sit for 90 days to a year, depending on timing and location.
Choose a cover crop (e.g., winter rye, peas and oats) and calculate seed quantity based on bed size.
Broadcast seeds on top of the soil, ensuring coverage and density.
Water seeds if necessary to aid germination.
Wait until cover crop matures (milk stage for winter rye) before termination.

tasks.task: Terminate cover crop and prepare for next stages.
subtasks: Use a tool (e.g., T-post and rope) to crimp cover crop material in a consistent direction.
Remove tarps and allow the plot to heat up slightly (2-3 weeks).
Repeat steam treatment by running irrigation.
Remove tarps again to reveal sheet mulch.

tasks.task: Establish garden beds and add compost.
subtasks: Mark out uniform garden beds (same size across all plots) with wood stakes and tomato twine.
Fill beds with manure-based compost, testing for herbicide contamination first.
Add mulch (wood chips) to walkways for weed suppression and moisture retention.

tasks.task: Directly seed or plant crops after preparing the plot.
subtasks: Plant cover crops or desired vegetables without tilling the soil.
Maintain the garden by addressing any weeds that emerge naturally.
